alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 7:15PM CST until January 04 at 2:08PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Clinch River Above Tazewell TN affecting Grainger, Hancock and Claiborne Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...Virginia... Clinch River Near Speers Ferry VA affecting Hancock and Scott Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clinch River Near Speers Ferry VA. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, County Road 627 just downstream floods. At 21.0 feet, One or two houses are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Sunday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 19.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 18.6 feet and begin rising again tomorrow evening. It will rise to 19.8 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.9 feet on 01/31/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued byMonday morning at 1100 AM EST.
